sentences.sContent: "I do not accept the Negro as my equal, " Douglas said. "And I deny that he is my brother.
sentences.sContent_eng: "I do not accept the Negro as my equal, " Douglas said. "And I deny that he is my brother.
sentences.sCn: “我不会接受黑人与我平等的思想，”道格拉斯说，“而且我拒绝把黑人当成我的兄弟。

sentences.sContent: It meant that I, a humble Negro girl, had just as much chance as anybody in the sight and love of God.
sentences.sContent_eng: It meant that I, a humble Negro girl, had just as much chance as anybody in the sight and love of God.
sentences.sCn: 这就意味着，我这样一个卑微的黑人女孩，也可以像其他人一样有很多机会受到上帝的关注和爱。

trans.tranOther: a word for a black person, usually considered offensive
relating to or characteristic of Negroes
